intro: Euphorbia galapageia, commonly known as the Galapagos spurge, is a succulent plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in a structure called a cyathium. It thrives in arid and coastal environments, adapting to the unique climate of its native habitat. Due to its ecological importance and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
